publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6872 Bill Kidd: UK Government Hits Poorest Hardest, New IFS Research—That the Parliament expresses concern that research by the Institute of Fiscal Studies has indicated that the Conservative-Liberal Democrat coalition government’s June 2010 UK Budget is regressive as it "shows that, once all of the benefit cuts are considered, the tax and benefit changes announced in the emergency Budget are clearly regressive" and that "Low-income households of working age lose the most as a proportion of income from the tax and benefit reforms announced in the emergency Budget". Supported by: Bob Doris*, Kenneth Gibson*, Aileen Campbell*, Bill Wilson*, Dave Thompson*, Stuart McMillan*, Brian Adam*, Elaine Smith*
S3M-6872 UK Government Hits Poorest Hardest, New IFS Research (lodged on 25 August 2010) Gil Paterson*, Maureen Watt*, Michael Matheson*, Jamie Hepburn*
